title: Helvectica \_\_\_\_\_\_?
content:
Looks like Helvectica to me... but there's something different from the cut that I have. Anyone know what exact font this is?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [adam.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229145426/http:/typophile.com/files/adam.gif) | 29.62 KB |
author: melo

comments.content: Looks like Neue Helvetica (75 Bold) to me.
It's been modified. Some of the terminals are rounded. Have a look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229145426/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/soft_rounded_sans/) for alternatives.
I figured the rounded terminals were a rendering issue. Oh well.

There is a freefont which was built after a typeface in an old book from Josef Müller-Brockmann. Which was obviously Helvetica. Now this »version« has rounded terminals, so try [Alte Haas Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20111229145426/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?q=haas&nb_ppp_old=10&page=1&text=Better+talk+to+Adam&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha) by yann le coroller.

@Stewf: your link is broken.
Looking a little more closely, Alte Haas Grostesk seems unusable due to the poor quality of the rendering :(
That’s the reason why they are free …
Melo - I doubt you'll find the font commercially available. It's probably a proprietary modification specially for Adam.
